posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This barbarian warrior has quite a few tricks up her sleeve:
She is a highly skilled archer, better than most rangers are. Her attack penetrates stoneskins and similar magical defences.
She is not afraid of going toe to toe with her enemies. She taunts them so they expose their weaknesses when they come at her, and avoids most attacks with her highly dexterous moves.
She knows how to use magic both to enhance her archery skills and her melee weapon, and to defend herself from harm. She knows several attack spells, and can cast fireballs from spells and with enchanted arrows.
She runs faster than most, and can use magic to move even faster. She can also use spells to trap or slow down her prey.
She also uses ordinary traps as a weapon.
She can pick simple locks and has spells to open the tougher ones.
She has also a little pixie-friend that can help her with difficult locks and help detect and disarm traps.
Sometimes she uses her magic to transform into a pixie herself and plays games with her little friend.

Strengths: Highly versatile character with a strong Ranged AB. With EA-V she does not depend on her own spells to kill mages.
She can also handle melee really well buffed with Stoneskin, Improved invisibility and extended Haste while taking advantage of the Taunt/ Expertise combination.
When she scribes scrolls of Flame weapon and GMW, she gets spells with a caster level higher than her own for +5 enchantment and 11-14 fire damage. Rage will also give a short boost to the damage.
Weaknesses:
Low hitpoints and a low will save, but she can cover that with defensive spells.
She is susceptible to dispels with only eight caster levels.

Edit: Added Disable Trap

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Not much to say here, Mick.

Barbarian apart from being a cool choice of class provides uncanny dodge & fast movement (valuable in low magic-20 lvl worlds) while retains full bab.

Very good ab despite the 8 mage lvls and some good arcane spell-power (II & Stoneskin comes to mind) and the valuable scribe scrolls feat, for free.

One minor thing, you seem undecided about BF & CS. I would drop expertise like a sack of potatoes (although i know why you have taken it) in this build, and take both.

Again, a nice elite archer.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:One minor thing, you seem undecided about BF & CS. I would drop expertise like a sack of potatoes (although i know why you have taken it) in this build, and take both.
Some of what makes this build so fun to play is that it can be adapted to different archer play-styles. This means that you can tweak the build in different directions.
If you play in a party, you will probably not need Expertise.
If you solo, you can play "run n'gun", and also use Called shot, and even traps and spells to debuff and slow your targets.
Stealth is also possible. I have not taken stealth skills here, but they are there for you to pick if you are willing to drop something else.
Choosing Expertise is for going melee when you get tired of running from mobs and lesser bosses, or if you get cornered. Expertise let you last a while even if your buffs get dispelled. Melee is a serious back up plan, even if it's not a #1 priority. Note that there is no melee weapon focus.
